item.title: Viral Anime GTA Clone Is Ditching Gacha But Not Being Shy About Ripping Off Spider-Man
item.content:encoded:
There‚Äôs the saying, ‚Äúgood artists copy, great ones steal.‚Äù And then there‚Äôs whatever Ananta is doing. The upcoming open-world RPG from NetEase developer Naked Rain is going viral again thanks to new footage from Tokyo Game Show 2025. While it might look like the latest round of Genshin Impact-inspired mobile anime slop, the developer has confirmed it won‚Äôt be relying on exploitative gambling mechanics to earn its keep. It will, however, be ripping off Spider-Man in every way it can.

First, let‚Äôs start with the new trailer. Released earlier this week, it shows seven minutes of gameplay depicting all the ways you can explore, fight, and hang out in Ananta‚Äôs urban playground. Taking the reins of special agents patrolling the streets for strange anomalies, the new footage is almost a greatest hits highlight reel of all the past games the upcoming mobile release is pulling from, including not just Grand Theft Auto and Spider-Man but also Watch Dogs, Sifu, and more. There‚Äôs fluid martial arts brawls and smartphone hacking games. And of course, there‚Äôs the web-singing people have been gawking at since the game was first announced.

It looks neat, and it‚Äôs impressive this is a game designed for mobile devices and not high-end consoles. Naked Rain is promising multi-level exploration from the ground-level streets to city rooftops, as well as interiors you can explore at different elevations. There are vehicles you can get in and drive, weapons you can pick up off the ground, from guns to golf clubs, and NPCs who will supposedly react to whatever chaos you‚Äôre causing while out exploring. ‚ÄúEvery choice ripples through the life of the city,‚Äù the developers write. We‚Äôll see.

For some players, this is a win-win-win. Steal one game mechanic and you‚Äôre a thief. But take a bunch from all different games, pour them into a blender, see what comes out, and you might be a genius, or at least someone with the potential to make NetEase a lot of money. For others, however, Ananta is a bit too ‚Äúshameless‚Äù when it comes to ripping off the competition. It‚Äôs not just that you can web-swing around town like Spider-Man, it‚Äôs that you can also use Venom-like powers to smash bad guys with attacks that look straight out of Spider-Man 2. Uncharted didn‚Äôt invent quick-time events, but some of these chase scenes look really on the nose.

This Ananta game has no shame üòÖ#Uncharted4 #NaughtyDog pic.twitter.com/ly53Bi6Ebi

‚Äî King J ü§¥üèø (@JMaine518) September 25, 2025

Marvel's Spider-Man 2: The Anime‚Ä¶ I mean, ANANTA looks absolutely incredible! It genuinely looks like Marvel's Spider-Man, GTA, Watch Dogs, and Sleeping Dogs all rolled into one stylish open world package! Will definitely be keeping my eyes on this game in the future! üëÄüéÆ pic.twitter.com/lEVNgvnDcP

‚Äî Evan Filarca (@EvanFilarca) September 23, 2025

Oh no, the Playstation supported Chinese game has taken all of the best elements of every game of the last 15 years and put it all in one free to play game!

I for one am outraged.

‚Äî Chr√≠ss (@Chriss_m) September 25, 2025

Whether all of this will ultimately make for a good game remains to be seen. Ananta could be a breakout free-to-play hit that makes people rethink what certain genre mashups are capable of, or it could just be a tricked-out car with no gas in the tank. One other big thing going for it is that, unlike a lot of games in this space, Ananta won‚Äôt be hocking pay-to-win character loot boxes, also known as gacha mechanics, in order to make money. Naked Rain confirmed to Famitsu (via Automaton) that the game‚Äôs monetization will instead rely on cosmetics and other customizable features ranging from outfits and cars to the player‚Äôs house.

It‚Äôs not the only post-Genshin Impact mobile RPG to be shifting away from gacha mechanics. The makers of Duet Night Abyss, which arrives on mobile next month, announced they too would be ditching the hero loot box grind and getting rid of star ratings for equipment to limit pay-to-win mechanics. It‚Äôs also doing away with stamina limits, another popular way for nickel-and-diming players on mobile. ‚ÄúIn the last test,‚Äù DecaBear says, ‚Äú[Testers] said our gameplay‚Äìwhich is built around fast-paced grinding‚Äìkept getting blocked by stamina limits,‚Äù producer DecaBear said. ‚ÄúAnd that felt pretty bad.‚Äù

item.title: LEGO Is Handing Out Early Presents for Star Wars Fans, This 2025 Advent Calendar Goes for Peanuts
item.content:encoded:
We still have a few other holidays to get through before the big ones at the end of the year, but you can get excited for them now with this LEGO Star Wars advent calendar. Truly, I can‚Äôt thing of a better brand to be making advent calendars for the holidays. Small, surprise LEGO builds are the perfect little toy and activity to be greeted with each day while counting down to Christmas. This Star Wars one is normally priced at $45, but for a limited time you can scoop it up for 16% off. That brings the price down to just $38, saving you a cool $7.

This LEGO Star Wars advent calendar is new for 2025 and will transform December into 24 days of fun for any Star Wars fan six years old and up. The set includes a very specific choice of iconic characters across the franchise. You won‚Äôt find Han Solo, Luke Skywalker, or Prince Leia here. You won‚Äôt even find Rey, Finn, the Mandalorian, or Grogu. Instead you get Babu Frik and a bunch of droids. C-3PO is there of course but you also get droids like R7-A7, BD-72, a scrap battle droid, and a super battle droid. BB-8 is adorably dressed up like a snowman and there is a Jawa that comes with a holiday sweater.

See at Amazon

There are even more droids that buildable like a Pit Droid, Gonk Droid, Buzz Droid, holiday versions of a Medical Droid and a Mouse Droid, B2EMO, Treadwell Droid, and a Probe Droid. Merry Droidmas everybody.

You also get elements of Babu Frik‚Äôs workshop which can be connected together by the time they‚Äôre all opened.

Let Star Wars Make Your Holiday Special

Maybe sometime along the way of this 24-day countdown with you new LEGO advent calendar, you make some time to checkout the infamous Star Wars Holiday Special of which most involved wish it to go away. The CBS made-for-television broadcast is set after A New Hope but before the yet-to-be-released Empire Strikes Back. It follows everyone‚Äôs favorite Wookie Chewbacca alongside Han Solo venturing to return to Chewie‚Äôs home planet of Kashyyyk to celebrate ‚ÄúLife Day.‚Äù After its first airing it had never been broadcast again nor re-released in any official capacity. It‚Äôs not good and is the right choice to make this LEGO advent calendar have nothing to do with it.

Order your LEGO Star Wars advent calendar today for the reduced price of just $38.

item.title: Microsoft Will No Longer Allow Israel To Use Its Tech For Mass Surveillance In Palestine
item.content:encoded:
The Guardian is reporting that Microsoft has cut off the Israeli military‚Äôs access to the technology that it has been using to conduct surveillance on phone calls in Palestine. According to the report, the Xbox company told Israeli officials that the military‚Äôs spy agency, Unit 8200, violated its terms of service by ‚Äústoring the vast trove of surveillance data in its Azure cloud platform.‚Äù 

This follows previous Guardian reporting from August on how Azure was being used to store Palestine communications, as Israel had been surveilling civilian phone calls in Gaza and the West Bank. Following the report, Microsoft had an external investigation conducted into its relationship with Unit 8200, which led to the cancellation of the unit‚Äôs access to its cloud storage and AI services. You can read the Guardian‚Äòs story for more of the minutiae, but the long and short of it is that this is a huge win for both the employees and external forces that have been calling for a boycott of Microsoft due to its relationship with the Israeli government, as it continues its ongoing attacks on the people of Palestine. Microsoft was added to the BDS Movement‚Äôs boycott list earlier this year, with the movement calling the company ‚Äúperhaps the most complicit tech company in Israel‚Äôs illegal occupation, apartheid regime and ongoing genocide against 2.3 million Palestinians in Gaza.‚Äù This included calls to cancel subscriptions to Xbox Game Pass, as well as boycotting games like Candy Crush, Minecraft, and Call of Duty, which are all owned by Microsoft‚Äôs various studios. We‚Äôve reached out to the BDS Movement for comment and will update the story if we hear back.

Brad Smith, the Vice Chair & President of Microsoft, sent an email to employees that was published on the company‚Äôs blog, in which he cited The Guardian‚Äôs reporting as the catalyst for this decision.

While our review is ongoing, we have found evidence that supports elements of The Guardian‚Äôs reporting. This evidence includes information relating to IMOD consumption of Azure storage capacity in the Netherlands and the use of AI services.

We therefore have informed IMOD of Microsoft‚Äôs decision to cease and disable specified IMOD subscriptions and their services, including their use of specific cloud storage and AI services and technologies. We have reviewed this decision with IMOD and the steps we are taking to ensure compliance with our terms of service, focused on ensuring our services are not used for mass surveillance of civilians.

As I said at our recent employee townhall, this does not impact the important work that Microsoft continues to do to protect the cybersecurity of Israel and other countries in the Middle East, including under the Abraham Accords.

I want to note our appreciation for the reporting of The Guardian. Its reports were based in part on sources outside Microsoft that had information we could not access in light of our customer privacy commitments. This helped inform our review.

While this is a victory, as both Smith and The Guardian note, Microsoft still has other longstanding relationships with the Israel Defense Forces, which include access to certain tech and services. But this is the first example of a United States company pulling its resources from Israel since the war with Gaza began.

item.title: Kirby Air Riders for Nintendo Switch 2 Has Already Sold Thousands on Amazon Pre-Orders Before Release
item.content:encoded:
A generation of Nintendo fans grew up playing the Kirby Air Ride on GameCube at every sleepover. And now this slept on kart racer‚Äôs franchise is finally coming back. It‚Äôs kind of crazy that the Nintendo Switch 2 is only getting a small handful of exclusive titles this year and two of them are kart racers. I guess Mr. Sakurai‚Äîdirector of the Super Smash Bros. games and creator of Kirby‚Äîreally just wanted to see his pink ball back in the driver‚Äôs seat of a warp store and Nintendo said ‚ÄúFine.‚Äù Kirby Air Riders is now available for pre-order over at Amazon.

The first Kirby Air Ride had a limited roster, just letting you race as different colors of Kirby. You could unlock Meta Knight and King DeDeDe, but they did not allow the option to choose your machine. Kirby Air Riders is fixing that by giving you a huge new cast of racers ‚Äî all of which have full access to the different machines to race on. Choose between Kirby, King Dedede, Meta Knight, Bandana Waddle Dee, Chef Kawasaki, and so many more characters. Each racer has their own unique special move they can unleash to give them the edge in a race.

See at Amazon

The machine choices have greatly expanded, but lots of fan favorites are returning. the speedy Turbo Star, the slippery Slick Star, and the intimidating Rex Wheelie are all back. New machines such as the heavyweight Battle Chariot are looking to be a fun time as well.

City Trial Is Back

Real fans of Kirby Air Ride know that the heart of this game is not in the racing modes. No, sir. You play this game for one thing and one thing only ‚Äî City Trial. This multiplayer free roam mode is back in Kirby Air Riders and it‚Äôs looking to be better than ever before. Zip around the floating city known as Skyah as you have minutes to find a good machine, collect power-ups and upgrades, then compete against up to 16 players online in a random field event. These could be standard races, battles to the death, darts but on karts, and so much more.

You can pre-order either the physical version or a digital code which you can enter into your Nintendo Switch 2 to install on release. The game is set to release later this Fall on November 20. Pre-order today for $70. Remember before pre-ordering that this title is exclusive to the Nintendo Switch 2 and will not run on your old, standard Nintendo Switch console

item.title: Remedy Isn‚Äôt Giving Up On Its Failed Co-Op Shooter
item.content:encoded:
Good morning and good day. I‚Äôm very busy right now, so let‚Äôs not waste any time and get right to today‚Äôs news. Welcome to Morning Checkpoint, Kotaku‚Äôs daily roundup of news and other stuff you might care about. This time we‚Äôve got info on a big FBC update, news on multiplayer in the MGS3 remake, and some other stuff, but I‚Äôm very busy and‚Ä¶yeah, okay, cool. Bye.

Remedy is trying again to relaunch its failed co-op shooter

FBC: Firebreak, Remedy‚Äôs co-op shooter released earlier this year, hasn‚Äôt been a big hit for the studio. While I enjoyed it for a few days, the game failed to hook me due to finicky menus, frustrating progression issues, and other complications that made it hard to enjoy with friends. Since launch, Remedy has spent a lot of time fixing and improving the game. Now, as announced in a Steam post on September 25, the studio is releasing a massive free content update that will change FBC in some big ways.

Our 1st free Major Update to FBC: Firebreak launches on September 29th. Breakpoint brings with it systemic overhauls, new content, and quality-of-life improvements.

Read our latest blog post for all the details (it's a big one): https://bit.ly/BreakpointFBCFirebreak

#FBCFirebreak

‚Äî Remedy Entertainment (@remedygames.com) 2025-09-25T13:01:03.362358702Z

The new update, named ‚ÄúBreakpoint,‚Äù is launching on all platforms on September 29. Perhaps the biggest change in this new update is the removal of the Job Board. It‚Äôs being replaced with a Crisis Board that fills up with randomly generated missions with various modifiers. The idea is to make FBC more replayable, surprising, and chaotic. To help with that, Remedy is also adding more variety to missions, new weapons, and fresh enemies to kill or be killed by. I‚Äôm also excited about the changes to progression, which will simplify some parts, making it easier to get cool guns and have fun, but will also add more customization options for weapons as players spend more time completing missions.

‚ÄúWe have taken a lot of feedback to heart,‚Äù explained the studio. ‚ÄúOver the summer, we have worked hard on releasing updates to the game. Still, Breakpoint is only the first major step, we know we need a few more, bringing significant improvements and new systems, as well as content, into the game, incorporating community feedback alongside our own ideas.‚Äù The team also thanked players for ‚Äústicking‚Äù around as it essentially redevelops FBC post-launch. I hope it all works out, and I‚Äôm excited to hop back in to the new FBC: Firebreak as we enter spooky season.

Payday 2 is getting a subscription service for all its DLC

Did you know that 2013‚Äôs Payday 2, a co-op heist shooter, has over 60 pieces of DLC? That‚Äôs wild, huh? The game has so much DLC that developer Starbreeze is now offering people a monthly subscription service that grants them access to all of it. The new sub comes in two flavors: $4.99 a month or $19.99 for six months. It‚Äôs not a horrible deal, and for new players or folks just wanting to play with friends who might own everything, it‚Äôs a fine option.

But many players aren‚Äôt happy that, alongside this subscription launch, the studio has increased the price for a bundle that includes all the DLC. Previously, buying all the DLC cost around $135. Now it‚Äôs marked up to $170. Yikes! Starbreeze tells PCGamesn that the price increase is ‚Äúcompletely unrelated‚Äù to the subscription service. Sure! Regardless, it‚Äôs left a bad taste in many mouths and is likely to make folks assume the new sub is just a way to squeeze more money out of folks not willing to pay $170+ for all the DLC.

Nintendo just released a new Fire Emblem game, but‚Ä¶

So a new Fire Emblem game was shadow-dropped overnight on September 24. That should be exciting. However, people who have downloaded and played Fire Emblem Shadows have discovered it‚Äôs a not-so-great Among Us-like free-to-play social deduction game. That‚Äôs not what a lot of Fire Emblem fans wanted, and early impressions are bad, with some people reporting that the game feels extremely underbaked and barebones. But don‚Äôt worry, there‚Äôs a battle pass and plenty of ways to spend money.

MGS Delta‚Äôs multiplayer mode is launching next month

On September 25, as part of Tokyo Games Show, Konami announced that the multiplayer mode for its recently released MGS3 remake will launch on October 30. It will be part of a bigger free update arriving for Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater next month.

The cat-and-mouse online PVP stealth mode will support up to 12 players across all platforms and is arriving about two months after MGS Delta: Snake Eater launched to mostly positive reviews. It doesn‚Äôt seem anything like my beloved Metal Gear Solid Online, but it could be fun, I guess.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7‚Äòs beta will include Zombies content

For the first time in the franchise‚Äôs long history, the next Call of Duty game‚Äôs beta will include some Zombies content. Players will be able to check out a small survival map and mode in the upcoming October beta, as well as standard multiplayer action, too. The beta starts on October 2 on all platforms.
